name: Computational Phonology Workshop
tagline: Part of the Computational Phonology seminar at Stony Brook University
body:
# Introduction

The purpose of this workshop is to allow students in Fall 2016's *Computational Phonology* seminar at Stony Brook University to present their research findings to a wider audience.
The unifying theme of all student presentations is the application of subregular computational models to phonology.
The program covers a wide range of phenomena, including harmony processes, word stress, and metathesis.
Some presentations also explore formal aspects of the computational models or extend them to other language domains, in particular syntax.

# Invited Speaker

The workshop program concludes with a *Frontiers* talk by [Adam Jardine](http://rci.rutgers.edu/~aj591/) ([Rutgers University](http://ling.rutgers.edu/)).
As is common for *Frontiers* talks, we will have dinner with the speaker afterwards at the Hilton Garden Inn.

# Date & Venue

**Date**: Monday, December 12, 2016  
**Time**: to be announced; approximately 10am to 6pm  
**Location**: Computational Linguistics Lab (SBS N-249)

# Program

to be announced

# Registration

No registration is required.

# Links

[Course website](https://github.com/StonyBrook-Lin626-F16/main)
